역시 명작;

[b]1998.

A year that shook the gaming landscape.

Where FPS's were all about the most kills racked up, and the biggest achievement was how fast you could complete a level. It all started to blend didn't it? And then that fateful day, Half-Life hit the scene; VALVe's very first game.

The world of video games would never be the same after that.[/b]

--

I think it's fair to assume that everyone and their mother have played or at least seen Half-Life before, as its legacy show. However, if you happen to be one of 7 people who haven't played it yet, let me indulge you for a moment as to why this one of the greatest games ever made.

[u]The Story[/u]
Most of us are familiar with the "experiment gone wrong" story. It's a classic archtype to set up; however, Half-Life did it in a way that was different from most other stories. In fact, HL's storytelling was much different to just about every first-person shooter up to that point. Most FPS's at the time required that the character go from point A to point B, while the story, if any, was backseat to the gameplay. Half-Life said "Fuck that nonsense.", and went the understated route, putting the story firsthand by actually pushing characters with dialouge, and putting you firsthand in Freeman's eye's to the whole time; no cutscenes are in the game whatsoever. And that's a good thing.

[u]The Gameplay[/u]
Now HL never reinvented the wheel when it came to gunplay. In fact, some would say it's downgraded in terms of other FPS's at the time, by not relying on arena-style combat with massive body explosions and having dozens of weapons. What HL did do was make the weapons feel fun. All the guns have a strong feel to them, like they would knock you back real hard, and all the enemies in the game give satistfying death squeel that makes you feel like a badass. Speaking of enemies, the A.I. is some of the best seen in any game, even today. Enemies will react to you appropiately as you feel they would, but no one enemy will feel cheaply hard or too easy relative to who they are, if that makes any sense. 

The game itself is very fast paced, with you moving from one area to the next at a breakneck pace. Nothing feel like it's dragging on, and sometimes you can get lost in the moment as one minute you are fighting soldiers, and the next it's aliens; this is a textbook example of pacing at it's finest.

[u]The Graphics[/u]
I won't lie, the graphics of HL have not aged the best. The game has clearly shown its age at this point, and even with the HD texture pack that comes with the Blue Shift expansion, that game still looks rather dated. However, none of this is to say that the game looks terrible by any means; in fact at the time of release, it was one of the best looking games on the market. The GoldSrc Engine was increadibly advanced for the time and pulled off some pretty advance textures and modeling at the time. And with the HD pack, the game still looks decent, even now.

Now Black Mesa: Source, well, that's a topic for a different day...

[u]Overall[/u]
It's clear that I love this games. It's clear that millions of other people love this game as well, as the score and sales proves that. The game has left a legacy that few other games have touched, and the sequals would continue to improve the series and be considered legends in themselves.

No game is perfect though, and even with Half-Life I must come to terms with this fact. Like I said ealier, its age is clearly shown, and as a side effect of this, it's a difficult game. Hard as hell even; it may just turn you off to it because of this. Keep in mind though, that this is just a factor of it being from the 90's, when all games were a kick-to-the-balls difficult. If you can push through it, then a great game awaits you beyond.

To me, this game is near perfect; so good in so many ways that any negatives are mearly nitpicking. You owe it to yourself, as a gamer or not, to at least try HL, and seen why it has left such an impact on the game industry.

Esse é um dos classicos perfeitos.Esse jogo é o resultado de qualidade dos jogos que conhecemos hoje. O design do mapa e cenarios foram genial para a época, quando a maioria dos jogos não tinham elementos de quebra-cabeças e hitórias inovadoras. As armas são de alto nivel para época alto nível. Sem dizer no final misterioso. É realmente uma obra de arte a qual todos os que amam jogos com boas histórias deveriam jogar.

This game is amazing, but I don't recommend it as it is not the best version of this game available on Steam. Pick up Half-Life: Source instead, as that has Source engine physics, effects, and water.

Otherwise, if you're going for completeness of your library, sure - go ahead and pick it up.

Half-Life переводится как "период полувыведения" или как "период полураспада". Я начал играть в неё еще с 5 лет и до сих пор мне эта игра нравится. Half-Life поражает не графикой (что оставляет желать лучшего), не эффектами, а тем на сколько погружаешься в игру. Со временем уже не замечаешь: расплытые текстурки, NPC с "угловатыми" моделями и плохой анимацией. Вся постановка сюжета завораживающа. На протяжении игры меня не оставляло чувство загадочности. Возраст этого шутера впечатляет, не каждая игра может похвастаться таким возрастом. В то время как Half-Life вышел, он произвел тогда самую настоящую, не побоюсь сказать такое слово, революцию в мире игр. Разработчики Valve всем показали как надо делать игры.
   Главное дейсвующее лицо в Half-Life - Гордон Фримен, физик-ядерщик. Все начинается с того, что Гордона направляют в тестовую камеру для проведения стандартного анализа кристалла. Последствия эксперимента, однако, оказываются катастрофическими. Гордона посылают на верх для вызова подмоги. Позже он обнаруживает, что эта "подмога" истребляет все живое в Черной Мезе, как монстров (есле так можно назвать их), так и людей, находящихся там. Позже он узнаёт от ученых из группы "Лямбда", что портал, между земным пространством и параллельным миром, удерживает огромный пришелец под названием Nihilant (Нихилант). Ученые отправляют его в параллельный мир, для того чтобы он уничтожил Нихиланта. Вот краткое описание сюжета.
   Сегодняшние современные дети, посмотрев на эту игру, скажут: "Фууууу, тут же графа отстой"- наигравшись в какие-то там GTA4, Warface, Call of duty. Так вот, главное в игре далеко не графика, а сам сюжет игры, чем Half-Life и поражает. Те кто в него не играет - много упускают.

Supposedly the best game of 1998 scoring higher than Grim Fandango or the first Thief. Ahh, the flaws of scoring and the sorry state of game journalism. GameSpot reports that it was revolutionary for its time but the improvements are very technical in nature, and because of that now obsolete. The game doesn’t stand the test of time, at least for me.

Maps in Half-Life make sense and it’s actually quite fun to come across a closed door that you later open from the other side. Of course after going through several tunnels, ladders, stairs, vents, cold room and some rubble. Unfortunately save for some crates here and there, there isn’t much interactivity in the environment. NPCs are scarce and don’t do much, usually just deliver a line of monologue or two. In the end it’s just the player character that can save the world, because nobody else is competent enough. And how our hero saves the world? By killing everything that moves, jumping on pipes and pressing occasional buttons.

Later is just more of the same: shooting things in the face, crawling through vents, destroying crates with a crowbar and jumping through obstacles. I don’t really understand how all those reviewers could list story or varied gameplay as the strong points of Half-Life.

I like the sound effects. It seems like some areas where specifically made to showcase some of them.

I played it a lot in multiplayer in high school and it was super fun then. On the other hand, even mediocre games are fun when played with a bunch of friends. This time I’ve played the single player campaign for 5 hours and gave up.

Half-Life is longer and a bit harder than Half-Life 2, but both Half-Life is just as good as Half-Life 2. Ok, maybe not the graphics but the gameplay is :b The steam version has beter graphics than the original CD version and most of the bugs has been patched. I really reccomend this game due to it's fantastic gameplay and storyline. The game also has multiplayer wich is alot like the first Counter Strike game and Team Fortress: Classic.

Since I first played Half-Life 2 before playing its predecessor, Half-Life, I expected the game to be low-res, boring, and nearly impossible due to game glitches like most games created around the time. Needless to say, I was completely wrong. Half-Life is just as good as Half-Life 2, if not better. There is strategy and multiple ways to navigate and beat each level of its campaign, and its multiplayer is stellar for a game made before 2000 (considering the multiplayer still works!). I had a blast playing its campaign on its most difficult setting. Remember: Fast Save is F6. The game is challenging enough that you will not get annoyed by its simplicity, but you also won't give up in frustration due to its complexity. I recommend this game 8/10 for anyone that plays FPS's, enjoys a good story, and won't go deaf from a large amount of amazing dialogue.

All in all this was a great game with an intellegent story, so before Half-Life 3 comes out (I heared it was 2014) and you have not played this game I seriously reccomend it.

This game....what can I say about it? The game that revolutionized the first person shooter genre for years to come. This game isn't like other shooters out there. It's linear, yet explorative and immersive. You solve puzzles, find secrets, interact with the NPCs, etc. This game has a great storyline with Alien and US Marine enemies fighting you and each other. This game is something I think all people who love FPS games must play, and something that the rest will should definitely should try out.

Esse jogo é simplesmente INACREDITÁVEL. Não só um dos melhores FPS, mas um dos melhores jogos que eu já joguei em todos esses longos invernos de vida.

Eu consigo imaginar perfeitamente os motivos de tanta glória para esse jogo. Que história fantástica. A parte técnica do jogo é fenomenal também, gráficos ainda agradáveis para um jogo com quase 15 anos de idade, com uma jogabilidade realmente muito boa, e uma bela variedade de armas e inimigos. E um level design matador. Mas o trunfo desse jogo, assim como de toda a franquia, com certeza é a história. Joguem prestando atenção em todos os detalhes, e eu prometo a vocês que será uma jornada inesquecível.

Half-Life is a classic. It was my first "true" FPS (my only other games prior being Minecraft and the Portal franchise) Admitedly, the graphics technology is... outdated, to say the least, but what it lacks in tech, it makes up for in every other regard. The design is spot on, and it has a natural learning curve and is great for both those who want to get into FPSs or veterans who have been around since the days of Wolfenstein. The story line is great in the fact that it is... the best adjective for this would be transparent. I do not mean that it is easy to see what comes next, and in fact it throws you several curveballs which mix up the gameplay even more. What I mean by transparent is that if all you care about is blasting aliens, the story will fade into the background and the dialouge will bother you no more than a blast from your shotgun straight into a zombie's face. Conversly, however, if you enjoy deep narratives with mysteries and solutions around every turn, Half-Life will delight you as well as you catch sight of some graffiti on a wall, overhear your enemies talking about your activities or even catch a rare glimpse of an odd man in a dark suit. Half-Life truly has something for everyone, form varied gameplay to an imersive story with both blended seamlessly together in a ride you'll be unlikely to forget.

What can be said about Half Life?  A hella lot.   Ages after its time, its still a shining example of what solid FPS games should offer.   Without placing all the glory on gun fights, it instead challenges the mind with often simple, and sometimes not, mazes and obstacles, that most run n' guns today have forgotten all about.

This game is simply amazing, even all these years later.
Fantastic classic game. I highly recommend this. 10/10.
Play it, just play it.

Ahhhhh.... where should I start...

When I played Half-Life for the first time I was very impressed because of the graphics and the physics. Now that I have re-played that game, it seems that it has it's little flaws that every game had back then. Besides these flaws, I still love the game because I think this is the best First-Person Shooter game ever made.

Yeah.. it is.. you can whine and cry because other AAA games has better graphics or story. But it was the first one which gave this huge freedom for the player, and I guarantee that none of those AAA games can provide the freedom that HL1 does. I guarantee it. This game is quite a challenge (if you play on a harder difficulty of course and you don't cheat). It does not force the player to listen long conversations with NPCs, not at all. Even the "Intro" is useful, because it tells about the story, and shows the facility, the Black Mesa compound. So not even the time what the intro consumes is in vain.

I highly recommend playing this game, of course in the eyes of those who have never played it before, but player AAA FPS games, this game looks like shit, but I guarantee you will find it very addictive.

Легендарна гра від Valve, яка полонила мільйони ігрових сердець, має простий, але в цей ж час динамічний геймплей, у який в прямому смислі затягує з вухами, а графіка хоч і не домальована але принаймі не відволікає від гри :D

What's truly remarkable is that even all these years after its initial release in 1998, Half-Life is still leagues better than most new first-person shooters released today.  It runs seamlessly, like liquid - a flawless continuous movement as you fall deeper and deeper into the madness of Black Mesa.  

It was genre-defining then and it's now a fizzling nostalgic experience pointing back to a time when videogames were made properly.  So many modern shooters owe so much to Valve's original masterpiece that without it, it would be difficult to imagine what we would actually have today.

A sublime, unparalleled, completely immersive experience.  I recommend it to everyone unreservedly.

L'un des meilleurs jeux FPS sortis ! Malgrès son âge relativement avancés, ils reste super par son scénario accentué d'une évolution constante de l'environnement qui entoure le joueur : couloirs (beaucoup, ya pas à dire), falaises, zones extérieures pleines de mines ou d'ET enragés, planétoïdes extraterrestres aux couleurs flashis... Du plaisirs, que ce soit dans les énigmes, nombreuses et bien pensées, ou bien les nombreuses phases de combat (échanges de tirs pas-précis-du-tout ou combat rapprochés, attention, ça tache), on ne s'ennuie jamais ; d'autant que l'histoire, linéaire (ou pas, selon votre aptitude à tout-tout-tout explorer... ou à vous perdre) est faite pour vous maintenir éveillé, voire sur les nerfs (quand ya plus de munitions et plus de vie) avec un dénouement final qui en ravira certain... et en laissera d'autre en plan. En bref ? A se procurer d'office ! De préférence durant les soldes, où il est vendu une bouchée de pain. BUY IT !!
PS : EVITEZ néanmoins de préférer sa version Source, pleine de bogues de script, et plutôt vide de nouveautés, vu son prix.

Beh che dire? Nonostante sia del 1998 Half Life riesce a tenervi incollati al monitor. Ok forse la grafica è un po' datata rispetto ai mostri di oggi ma una volta all'interno dei laboratori di Black Mesa l'ambiente diventerà molto ben fatto.
L'intelligenza artificiale è eccezionale per quel periodo, infatti il gioco ebbe successo (e seguito) grazie ad essa.
Il doppiaggio in italiano non è molto curato visto che sono presenti 2/3 doppiatori per tutti i personaggi, tra l'altro sono tutti uguali.
Il sonoro pecca spesso di realismo e talvolta vi è addirittura silenzio.
A parte questo, Half Life è un gioco da avere!!!
